intro: Sideritis almeriensis, commonly known as Almería sida, is a flowering plant native to southern Spain. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Sideritis almeriensis is also valued for its medicinal properties, often used in traditional remedies.
